arts.ttl: Luke Williams says Swansea City 'have to find a way' to halt woeful form as boos ring out after Coventry City loss
arts.sum: The Swans fell to defeat at home to Coventry City

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard gives 'special' verdict as Coventry City secure first win in Swansea for 75 years
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. “It was a very complete performance, and other than a couple more goals to make it feel even more comfortable because although it was comfortable, 2-0 is never always done,” said the City head coach, reflecting on the three points and clean sheet which extends the club’s run to four victories in the league and leaves them just three points off the play-off places.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings as Simms and Thomas-Asante combine to sink Swansea - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Jack Rudoni was denied by two good saves and Thomas-Asante a decent block as City pushed for a third early in the second half as they continued to look good on their lead. First half goals from strike partners Ellis Simms and Brandon Thomas-Asante put the Sky Blues on course for what was their first win at Swansea since 1950!

arts.ttl: Coventry ease to fourth straight league victory over out-of-form Swansea
arts.sum: First-half goals from Ellis Simms and Brandon Thomas-Asante proved enough for Frank Lampard’s Sky Blues.

arts.ttl: Swansea City v Coventry City live updates and team news from South Wales
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. The Swans will be weakened by the absence of the influential 29-year-old midfielder who completed his move to the Sky Blues on Friday tea-time, joining for an undisclosed fee (reported to be between £3.5m-£4m) and signing a three-and-a-half year contract, although he also won't be pulling on a Coventry shirt today due to an agreement between the two clubs.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard keeps powder dry as Coventry City prepare to navigate final days of the transfer window
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. We’re happy with what we’ve got.”

arts.ttl: 'Statement transfer' - Coventry City man on the new signing that's got the dressing room buzzing - CoventryLive
arts.sum: Asked what the club are getting in Grimes, who has signed a three-and-a-half year contract, Latibeaudiere said: “They’ve got a good player, an experienced player who has played a lot of games and who is always available. Joel Latibeaudiere insists the signing of his former Swansea skipper Matt Grimes is a “big statement” from Coventry City which shows the direction the club are going in.

arts.ttl: Confirmed: Frank Lampard completes first Coventry City transfer amid 'twist of fate'
arts.sum: Coventry today said that the 29-year-old midfielder had joined for an undisclosed fee, having signed a three-and-a-half year deal at the CBS Arena following a decade with the Swans. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard explains exactly what Coventry City are getting from 'dynamic' first signing Matt Grimes
arts.sum: Frank Lampard has explained exactly what he feels Coventry City are getting with his first signing, Matt Grimes – a player he’s admired since his days as manager of Derby County six or seven years ago. Asked if his experience and leadership was much-needed, Lampard said: “I think it’s always a balance of a team to try to have experience within it – people who know what it takes and who can help the younger players in the team alongside them and help them improve; help us improve.

arts.ttl: Matt Grimes joins Coventry City as star explains 'difficult' decision to leave Swansea City
arts.sum: Swansea City have officially parted company with skipper Matt Grimes, who has joined Championship rivals Coventry City
